meanings.definition: Relating to the geographical distribution of plants.
meanings.sent1: The phytogeographical map showed where different plants grow.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use phytogeographical data to understand plant habitats.
meanings.sent3: The phytogeographical patterns of flowers made the botanist smile.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a phytogeographical wonderland, with plants from all over the world.
meanings.sent5: The phytogeographical diversity of the rainforest was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: Study of the geographic distribution of plants.
meanings.sent1: Phytogeographical helps us learn where plants live around the world.
meanings.sent2: Botanists use phytogeographical to map out plant habitats.
meanings.sent3: The phytogeographical class was full of interesting plant facts.
meanings.sent4: In college, she specialized in phytogeographical studies.
meanings.sent5: The book on phytogeographical was a fascinating read.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the distribution of plant species in different regions.
meanings.sent1: The phytogeographical differences between the two forests were striking.
meanings.sent2: The phytogeographical patterns varied greatly from one area to another.
meanings.sent3: His phytogeographical observations led to new plant discoveries.
meanings.sent4: The phytogeographical boundaries were clearly defined by the researchers.
meanings.sent5: The phytogeographical analysis revealed interesting plant migration patterns.
